description: Submission of Audited Annual Financial Statements to AGSA, DPE and Parliament within 30 days of board approval as required by PFMA Section 55.
notes: AFS submitted on 30 November 2024. Unqualified opinion first time in 6 years.

description: Annual King IV governance compliance assessment and disclosure in integrated annual report as required by JSE Listing Requirements and King IV Report on Corporate Governance.
notes: 94% of King IV principles applied. Partial application for 3 principles with explanation provided.

description: Annual air quality compliance reporting to DFFE for all 15 coal power stations in terms of Atmospheric Emission Licence (AEL) conditions.
regulatoryBody: DFFE - Department of Forestry, Fisheries and the Environment
documentReference: NEMA: Air Quality Act No. 39 of 2004
notes: 11 of 15 stations exceed minimum emission standards for SOx. Variance applications submitted. R5m administrative fine paid.

description: NERSA electricity generation, transmission and distribution licence compliance including reporting obligations and tariff adherence.
notes: All licence conditions met. Tariff implementation compliant. MYPD6 application submitted on time.

description: Public Procurement Act and PFMA supply chain management compliance, irregular expenditure prevention and consequence management requirements.
notes: Legacy State Capture irregular expenditure of R4.2bn under consequence management. 18 disciplinary cases active. 6 criminal referrals to NPA.

description: Annual Employment Equity Report submission to the Department of Employment and Labour in terms of the Employment Equity Act.
notes: EEA2 and EEA4 reports submitted. African male representation at 58.4%, female representation at 34.2%.

description: Broad-Based Black Economic Empowerment compliance per the Amended Codes of Good Practice. Eskom as a state entity measured on all five elements.
documentReference: B-BBEE Act No. 53 of 2003, Amended Codes 2015
notes: Level 3 contributor. 30% of procurement from Black-owned suppliers. Skills development investment R4.2bn.

description: Submission of Annual Financial Statements to AGSA, DPE and Parliament as required by PFMA.
notes: AFS submitted October 2024 with KPMG unqualified opinion. Going concern emphasis retained.

description: Port tariff compliance with Ports Regulator approved tariff structure for Transnet National Ports Authority.
notes: FY2024 tariff schedule compliant. FY2025 application submitted September 2024.

description: PFMA supply chain management compliance and State Capture-related procurement consequence management.
documentReference: PFMA / Prevention and Combating of Corrupt Activities Act
notes: R6.2bn irregular expenditure from 2016-2020 under review. 24 disciplinary cases. 12 civil recovery actions. SIU proclamation R22/2019 ongoing.

description: Environmental impact management and compliance for port operations, pipeline spills and railway activities in terms of NEMA.
notes: Annual environmental compliance report submitted. Minor pipeline spill at Alrode remediated. Environmental management programme on track.

description: Compliance with Labour Relations Act including recognition agreements with SATAWU, UNTU and other bargaining council obligations.
notes: Three-year wage agreement signed April 2024. Bargaining council consultations on schedule. No outstanding unfair labour practice findings.

description: SACAA Air Operator Certificate (AOC) compliance and IATA Operational Safety Audit (IOSA) certification maintenance.
documentReference: Civil Aviation Act No. 13 of 2009 / IOSA Standards Manual
notes: AOC renewed. IOSA certification valid August 2024 to August 2026. 4 minor observations closed.

description: Annual Financial Statements submission per PFMA and Companies Act requirements.
documentReference: PFMA Section 55 / Companies Act No. 71 of 2008
notes: AFS submitted with qualified opinion noting going concern, negative equity. Improvement from prior year noted by auditors.

description: Compliance with Consumer Protection Act for airline passenger rights including cancellation, refund and delay policies.
notes: Cancellation policy updated. Refund processing time reduced to 7 days. No outstanding NCC complaints.

description: Annual Employment Equity Report and EE Plan compliance for SAA's post-restructuring workforce of 4,000 employees.
notes: EEA2 submitted. African representation at executive level improved to 68%. Female representation 42%.

description: NCACC (National Conventional Arms Control Committee) compliance for all Denel defence product exports including end-user certificates and reporting.
notes: All export permits in order. End-user certificates obtained for Rooivalk and LMT contracts. Quarterly NCACC reports submitted.

description: Annual Financial Statements submission to AGSA and DPE per PFMA requirements.
notes: FY2024 audit in progress. AGSA estimated completion March 2025. Expect qualified opinion improving to unqualified if pension deficit accounting resolved.

description: OHS Act compliance at all Denel manufacturing facilities including pyrotechnics, explosives handling and heavy engineering operations.
documentReference: Occupational Health and Safety Act No. 85 of 1993
notes: R2.5m fine issued for safety violations at Swartklip facility. Remediation plan approved. 2 facilities under improvement notices.

description: Compliance with LRA recognition agreements and collective bargaining obligations with NUMSA, NUM and Solidarity at Denel manufacturing sites.
regulatoryBody: CCMA / Metal and Engineering Industries Bargaining Council
notes: FY2024 wage agreement concluded May 2024 at 6.5% increase. All salary arrears cleared by March 2022. No outstanding unfair labour practice findings.

description: B-BBEE compliance per the Amended Codes. Denel is an SOE and must achieve minimum B-BBEE Level 2 in terms of shareholder requirements.
notes: Level 2 contributor maintained. 42% of discretionary spend to black-owned suppliers. Skills development 6.2% of payroll.

description: B-BBEE supplier development and procurement compliance for the NDP capital programme.
documentReference: B-BBEE Act / PPPFA / Preferential Procurement Regulations
notes: Local content requirement of 55% for locomotive contract under review. CRRC contract local content at 52%. Plan to achieve 55% by December 2025.

description: Water Use Licence compliance for all water abstractions by Eskom power stations from key river systems including Vaal, Olifants and Komati.
regulatoryBody: DWS - Department of Water and Sanitation
notes: All WUL conditions met. Effluent discharge within authorised limits. Water conservation programme reduced abstraction by 12%.

description: Compliance with Air Services Licensing Act and bilateral air services agreements for SAA international routes.
regulatoryBody: SACAA / DOTL - Department of Transport and Logistics
documentReference: Air Services Licensing Act No. 115 of 1990 / ICAO
notes: All bilateral air service agreements current. New bilateral with India signed for Mumbai route. ICAO SARPs compliance confirmed.

description: NNR (National Nuclear Regulator) licence compliance for Koeberg Nuclear Power Station, Unit 1 and Unit 2.
notes: Koeberg life extension approval received. Unit 1 extended to 2044, Unit 2 to 2045. IAEA safety review completed with positive findings.

description: King IV governance compliance assessment for Transnet SOC Limited and all material subsidiaries.
documentReference: King IV Report on Corporate Governance 2016
notes: 96% of King IV principles applied. Partial application for principle 6 (remuneration policy) with explanation in Annual Report.

description: King IV governance compliance for Denel SOC Limited board and governance structures.
documentReference: King IV Report on Corporate Governance 2016
notes: 88% King IV compliance. Partial application on remuneration, stakeholder inclusivity and information technology governance. Improvement plan in place.

description: Public Finance Management Act compliance including Section 54 significant transactions, irregular expenditure reporting and supply chain management.
documentReference: Public Finance Management Act No. 1 of 1999
notes: PFMA compliance framework updated post-business rescue. Section 54 approval obtained for fleet rejuvenation. Irregular expenditure at R180m in FY2024, down from R2.4bn during rescue period.
